extra.message: Affected versions of @hono/node-server are vulnerable to Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions.

cwe: CWE-755: Improper Handling of Exceptional Conditions
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: @keystone-6/core 3.x before 3.0.2 will incorrectly inline `NODE_ENV` to "development", causing non- production code to run in production builds if this environment variable is used in control flow. Upgrade to @keystone-6/core 3.0.2.

cwe: CWE-547: Use of Hard-coded, Security-relevant Constants
CWE-74: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: Don't call `system`. It's a high-level wrapper that allows for stacking multiple commands. Always prefer a more restrictive API such as calling `execve` from the `exec` family.

cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: The function `gets` does not impose any size limitation to what it writes to `buffer`. That may lead to a stack buffer overflow if there is no validation on the size of the input.

cwe: CWE-120: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: Avoid 'gets()'. This function does not consider buffer boundaries and can lead to buffer overflows. Use 'fgets()' or 'gets_s()' instead.

cwe: CWE-676: Use of Potentially Dangerous Function
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: Don't call `system`. It's a high-level wrapper that allows for stacking multiple commands. Always prefer a more restrictive API such as calling `execve` from the `exec` family.

cwe: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: The function `gets` does not impose any size limitation to what it writes to `buffer`. That may lead to a stack buffer overflow if there is no validation on the size of the input.

cwe: CWE-120: Buffer Copy without Checking Size of Input ('Classic Buffer Overflow')
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: Detected string concatenation with a non-literal variable in a util.format / console.log function. If an attacker injects a format specifier in the string, it will forge the log message. Try to use constant values for the format string.

cwe: CWE-134: Use of Externally-Controlled Format String
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: Detected string concatenation with a non-literal variable in a util.format / console.log function. If an attacker injects a format specifier in the string, it will forge the log message. Try to use constant values for the format string.

cwe: CWE-134: Use of Externally-Controlled Format String
metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license

extra.message: RegExp() called with a `query` function argument, this might allow an attacker to cause a Regular Expression Denial-of-Service (ReDoS) within your application as RegExP blocks the main thread. For this reason, it is recommended to use hardcoded regexes instead. If your regex is run on user-controlled input, consider performing input validation or use a regex checking/sanitization library such as https://www.npmjs.com/package/recheck to verify that the regex does not appear vulnerable to ReDoS.

metadata.license: Semgrep Rules License v1.0. For more details, visit semgrep.dev/legal/rules-license
